    Note: This is a "User Page" (click for a list of all user pages on TechNet Wiki). User pages on TechNet Wiki exist for the following reasons:

    1. To link to these pages from various online profiles, blog posts, etc. 
    2. To allow collaboration on filling out such information. 
    3. To allow easy editing for filling out such information. 
    4. To act as an aggregation or collection of links that help define what a person does.

    Alessandro Alpi works in the IT area as a developer since 2000 to 2005 and as a DBA/DBDeveloper/.net Developer since 2005. This passion started when he was 11 years old, with his wonderful C64. He worked as a web solutions developer (between classic ASP to the most recent versions of ASP.NET), windows application and services developer with languages C# and VB.Net. Starting from 2005 he begun to study the data layer, using SQL Server deeply. He actually works as DBA and software architect. He is also a trainer and a speaker, taking sessions on Database Lifecycle Management, .Net Framework and Microsoft SQL Server. He's working on Windows Azure based environments (both Paas and Iaas) and he's following the ALM processes of his team (applying SCRUM agile methodology).

    Alessandro is a staff member of dotnethell.it community and you can find him on its forums.
    You can find him also on SQL Server MSDN italian forums and on StackOverflow.
    He is an Italian language moderator on MSDN Translation Wiki  for the MSDN Library and SQL Server Books Online.
    Alessandro is one of the Italian PASS SQL Saturday organiser. He is the local responsible for the SQL Saturday in Parma.

    Microsoft Recognitions


    Alessandro is SQL Server Microsoft MVP since 2008. The expertise is SQL Server: System Administration.


    His technology interests are: Visual Studio ALM, .Net framework and Microsoft Azure.
    MVP Profile here.


    Microsoft Certifications

    Alessandro is Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) since October 2013. Following there's the list of the Microsoft Certifications he has achieved.

    Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS)

    		  Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS)
     70-432: Microsoft SQL Server, Implementation and Maintenance
     70-433: Microsoft SQL Server, Database Development

    Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP)


    		  Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP)
     70-451: esigning Database Solutions and Data Access Using Microsoft SQL Server

    Microsoft Certified Trainer

    		  Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT)
     70-432: Microsoft SQL Server, Implementation and Maintenance
     70-433: Microsoft SQL Server, Database Development
